newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai govt rubber agency raises intervention price.
newsitem.headline: Thai govt rubber agency raises intervention price.

text.p: Thailand's National Rubber Policy Committee agreed on Wednesday to raise its rubber intervention price to 29.00 baht ($1.11) a kg from 27.50, Deputy Prime Minister Sukavich Rangsitphol said.
He said the government should refrain from buying physical rubber directly to prop up prices. But it instead would resort to supporting the commodity by buying forward contracts.
Sukavich said the government would buy grade 3 unsmoked sheet rubber at 29.00 baht/kg and grade 4 at 24.00 until end-July.
The scheme was extendable, depending on the situation at that time, he added.

The government had bought 45,100 tonnes of RSS3 grade in the fob market. Sukavich said delivery must be by May 31 instead of June and payment would be made three days instead of 15 days after delivery.
He estimated that natural rubber production would reach 1.8 million tonnes this year, averaging 140,000 tonnes a month.
